title: API key 403 (quota exceeded) causes unbounded retry loop instead of auto-pass
description:
When OpenRouter returns HTTP 403 (key limit exceeded), the pilot retries every ~5 seconds for 5+ minutes instead of switching to auto-pass mode. The 402 (prompt tokens limit) case correctly triggers auto-pass, but 403 is missing from the permanent failure check.

In game_20260210_234529, all four players hit the 403 limit around 00:17:00. Three of them (Sonnet Valley, Gem25F Analyst, Gem3F ESPN) entered a retry loop generating 100+ error lines each over ~5 minutes. Only Haiku Gramps switched to auto-pass — because it hit a 402 first.

Evidence:
- ~/mage-bench-logs/game_20260210_234529/Sonnet Valley_errors.log: 112 lines of 403 errors from 00:17:07 to 00:22:03
- ~/mage-bench-logs/game_20260210_234529/Gem25F Analyst_errors.log: ~115 lines of 403 errors from 00:17:05 to 00:22:09
- ~/mage-bench-logs/game_20260210_234529/Gem3F ESPN_errors.log: ~120 lines of 403 errors from 00:17:02 to 00:22:19

Source: puppeteer/src/puppeteer/pilot.py:725 — permanent failure check only matches '402' and '404', not '403'

Suggested fix: Add '403' to the permanent failure check at line 725:
```python
if "402" in error_str or "403" in error_str or "404" in error_str:
```
